title: Your Snowdown Shop Is Disappointing
body:
I was really looking forward to the Snowdown skin shop but after all that wait it was a big let down. i thought the shop was suppose to offer personalized offers towards the champions you play, but this wasn't the case. i was hoping for a cheap skin for {{champion:103}} as challenger isn't being sold anymore and she is who i have been maining. I ended up drawing two Ashe skins (20 and 70% off) and i have a mere 2.2k mastery on her  so like 4 games. I also pulled 2 {{champion:19}} skins (one of them going on sale later this month) and i have only about 20 normal games on him.

So to conclude im disappointed with the "personalized" offers i got from this, i don't know how the math works but why did i pull a skin for 2.2k mastery Ashe when i 70k on Riven

Furthermore from the wider sample space of 2 smurf accounts and 3 friend accs, ashe tends to be popular all my accounts have been offered 2 ashe skins and two of my friends have been offered ashe skins they own. {{item:3070}}

I don't know what you guys are talking about, but I got skins that I particularly like and want. I got Headhunter Rengar, who I have LvL 5 with, Mecha Kha'Zix who I've recently started playing a lot and like a lot. Then I got Prototype Viktor too, who I play every so often, but also enjoy playing. After that though, I got skins for people that I don't play much, like Arcade Riven, Ace of Spades Ezreal and Chosen Master Yi.

So for me, I like the skins
Quite disappointing that 2 off my offers are champions I don't even own.  Did I do something wrong here?

If you don't own the champion the discount will include a discount on the champion as well as the skin.
I didn't own Fizz but I got 70% off Fizz + Void Fizz

There is I higher change of getting good skins in the weekly sale

A bit of champion diversity could be nice. I understand that what you get is random and the idea isn't for players to buy ever skin, which is fine. But when you get the 3 shen skins you don't have and two singed skins. it's a bit meh. It'll be nice to get some skins that were "maybe" instead of just a "no"
Although riot offers sales week week which is cool, so I'm not to fused.

On a side note, it was fun clicking and unlocking each portrait.
my fav part was clicking and seeing challenger ahri....... worst part it wont let you buy her {{sticker:zombie-nunu-tears}}
Got a bunch of Tristana skins and other skins for champions I don't own. You'd probably have better luck with weekly sales.
i'm very happy with my prom queen annie for 156 rp although not the best skin but that is god damn cheap.

4 of the deals i got were bundles for champs i dont own or want. Its kind of ridiculous that my "Deals" cost a crap tonne for stuff that i didnt want in the first place. If i wanted those champs and their respective skins i wouldve bought the champ. 

Did anyone else think it was gonna be all skins like i did? I'm just disappointed i guess. {{item:3070}}
All of mine were champs that I play often but none of the deals were close to attractive. You can't have your cake and eat it I guess.
I think its bugged too. Swamp Master Kennen in the normal store is 520 RP but in the Snowdown Shop its listed as 1120 RP, which has already included the 20% price reduction. I don't even own Kennen!
The 1120 price is the champion price plus the skin price with the 20% reduction applied.
Ahhhh gotcha. Thanks for the clarification. Still too much hahaha

Even if you didn't get the skin you wanted, how is it so disappointing? I mean like riot didn't have to put these exclusive sales up. So I don't see how there can be a problem even if you didn't get the skin you wanted
Mostly because it is suppose to be personalized but i get two skins for a champ i have played twice and have no plan on playing
I personally got skin offers on 6 different champions that I had at least 10k mastery points, so I wasn't disappointed with the skins I got offered, not sure how it decides which skins to discount.
